newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Marine sentry shot on California base.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Marine sentry shot on California base.

text.p: A sentry guarding an airfield at the Marine Corps Air Ground Combat Centre here was shot twice early Wednesday.

Lance Cpl. Wesley Grimm, 22, heard a disturbance at about 2:30 a.m. local time and when he went to investigate he was shot in the right shoulder and the right side of the chest, said Marine spokesman Cpl. C.J. Young.

The injuries were not life-threatening and Grimm was in stable condition at the naval hospital on base, he said. Young said Grimm was shot with a 9-mm automatic pistol, the type that is general issue to Marines.

"There is always more than one sentry on duty," said Young, who could not say whether anyone witnessed the incident at the base in the Mojave Desert some 100 miles east of Los Angeles. The shooting is under investigation.
